rounds.event: World War II: Soviet forces liberate the Łódź Ghetto. Of more than 200,000 inhabitants in 1940, fewer than 900 had survived the Nazi occupation.
births: Trevor Williams, English singer-songwriter and bass player

rounds.event: Silvertown explosion: A blast at a munitions factory in London kills 73 and injures over 400. The resulting fire causes over £2,000,000 worth of damage.
President Gerald Ford pardons Iva Toguri D'Aquino (a.k.a. "Tokyo Rose").
births: Benjamin Ayres, Canadian actor, director, and photographer

rounds.event: The United States Senate votes against joining the League of Nations.
births: Bernard Dunstan, English painter and educator
Javier Pérez de Cuéllar, Peruvian politician and diplomat, 135th Prime Minister of Peru

rounds.event: Four-man Team N2i, using only skis and kites, completes a 1093 mi trek to reach the Antarctic pole of inaccessibility for the first time since 1965 and for the first time ever without mechanical assistance.
deaths: Hrant Dink, Turkish-Armenian journalist and activist
